tasks.task: Explain the initial perception of no-till farming and runoff comparison to conventional tillage.
subtasks: Describe the previous belief that no-till had more runoff than conventional tillage.
Mention the method used in no-till practice (tilling some areas, leaving others untilled, and irrigating with sprinklers).
Describe the observed higher water runoff in the initial years of no-till practice.
Explain how the no-till treatment was used as a high runoff check.
Describe the shift in mindset as results changed over time (no-till becoming a low runoff practice after three years).
Discuss the challenge in getting people to adopt no-till practices initially but the eventual change.

tasks.task: Reflect on the process of adopting sustainable agricultural practices.
subtasks: Recognize the initial skepticism about no-till practices due to higher runoff.
Acknowledge the role of research (three-year observation period) in changing the understanding of no-till benefits.
Note the persistence needed to change farming practices (mentality shifts taking time).
